LanguageData.BorealForest.label: 針葉樹林
LanguageData.BorealForest.description: Forests of coniferous trees. Despite the harsh winters, boreal forests sustain a diverse population of small and large animals, and have warm summers.
LanguageData.Tundra.label: ツンドラ
LanguageData.Tundra.description: These mostly-frozen plains bear almost no trees and little vegetation. There are a few small animals interspersed with large herds of migratory grazers and their predators.
LanguageData.ColdBog.label: 寒帯湿地
LanguageData.ColdBog.description: A wetland packed with trees and vines. Much of the marshy land here can't support heavy structures, moving around is slow due to choking vegetation. Disease is endemic in this dense, wet ecosystem.
LanguageData.IceSheet.label: 大氷原
LanguageData.IceSheet.description: Sheets of ice which can be kilometers thick. There is no soil for plants to grow in. The only animals here are migrating to somewhere else - or badly lost.
LanguageData.SeaIce.label: 海氷
LanguageData.SeaIce.description: Permanent ice sheets floating on water. There is no soil for plants to grow, no minerals to mine, and almost no animal life.
